Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Chris Chike is, by most accounts, the greatest Dance Dance Revolution player in the world.; Before he turned to DDR — before he could even vote — he spent time as the greatest Guitar Hero player in the world, too.; Chike first tried DDR in 2005, after his older brother got him a copy of the game for his thirteenth birthday.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: It’s something that few other elite Dance Dance Revolution players really bother with, Clark said.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Clark recalled the song required about 800 steps at 220 beats per minute for two minutes, a feat of agility not entirely dissimilar to an Olympic sprint.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “How someone can even have the physical stamina to do that let alone have the mental fortitude to continue when one tiny mistake is the end of the run … it’s hard to even come up with words for this kind of thing,” Clark said.
